summary: All my models so far. Includes a few textures too.
descriptionHtml:
[color=red][size=4]Please note:
In light of the recent Steam pay walls, my permissions have
changed.  
--You may not use any of my meshes in a mod you're charging for


--You may not alter my meshes without my permission    


[size=3]Any textures made for the vanilla horse will work with these meshes.[/size][/size][/color]

For good screenshots of the models using Slof's textures check out my other mods.

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38412/?]
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38412/?[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/34940/?]
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/34940/?[/url]


The texture paths on the nifs are the same as vanilla. IE. arabmare.nif is textures/actors/horse/horse01.dds, saddlelight.nif is textures/actors/horse/saddle.dds, etc.

The meshes are remakes of the vanilla Bethesda horse. Use them as you wish; just give me credit. The textures aren't very good. Feel free to modify them as you need.


The saddles are resized to fit the horses. The arab saddles only fit the arab type models. Shadowmere's eyes are mapped different from the vanilla horse. (Uses the darker eye
seen on the texture files.) I've only added the glowing eyes to him/her. If you want to add the other controllers too, feel free to do so.

Stallion parts are mapped to the upper left corner similiar to Slof's textures.

 




Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim and the Creation Kit.
Thanks to InsanitySorrow for the ReadMe Generator this ReadMe is based on.
Thanks to the Blender, Paint.net, Nifscope and GIMP developers for providing free software.
Thanks to Hanaisse (Tes Alliance) for the 'Creating Armor in Skyrim' tutorial.
author: FieryMarigold
